intro: Androsace carnea f. halleri, commonly known as the Haller's pink, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and clusters of pink or magenta flowers. The plant typically thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its flowers are usually borne on slender stems and bloom in early summer. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in garden conditions with minimal care.
